intro: Stemmadenia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered stemmadenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is its showy, clustered flowers, which are usually pink or purple in color. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
